creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: nude Eve holding a piece of fruit near PL shoulder; looking toward a snake in ULC; grazing stag in back
inscription:
Signature, Stamp

in graphite on verso: 8008 | B. 12I | indecipherable marks
markings: brown stamps on verso, lower left and lower right, respectively: Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staatliche Kunstsammlungen, Dresden (Lugt 1616 and Lugt 1618, for duplicate); black collector\'s stamp on recto, lower right, unidentified
provenance: Kupferstich-Kabinett, Staatliche Kunstsammlungen duplicate, Lugt 1616 and 1618, Dresden. John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: monogram in plate, along left edge: [AG]
title: Eve
